text: Iris Apfel (n√©e Barrel; August 29, 1921 - March 1, 2024) was an American businesswoman, interior designer, and fashion icon. She was born in Queens, New York City. Apfel studied at the University of Wisconsin. Apfel took part in several design restoration projects, including work at the White House for nine presidents: Truman, Eisenhower, Kennedy, Johnson, Nixon, Ford, Carter, Reagan, and Clinton. In 2013, she was listed as one of the fifty "Best-Dressed over 50" by The Guardian. In November 2016, Apfel was awarded the Women's Entrepreneurship Day Pioneer Award for her work in fashion at the United Nations in New York City. In 2018, Mattel created a Barbie doll in Apfel's image, making her the oldest person to ever have a Barbie made in her image. In 2019, at the age of 97, she signed a modelling contract with global agency IMG. Apfel celebrated her 100th birthday on August 29, 2021. She was Jewish. Apfel died at her home in Palm Beach, Florida from natural causes on March 1, 2024, at the age of 102. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2024 deaths Category:American centenarians Category:American designers Category:American Jews Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Jewish centenarians Category:Models from New York City
